div.p: RATZEBURG or Ra tzemburg, an ancient town of Germany, in the circle of Lower Saxony, and in the duchy of Lawenburgh, with a biſhop’s fee and a caſtle. The town depends on the duchy of Lawenburg, and the cathedral church on that of Ratzburg. lt is feated on an eminence, and almoſt ſurrounded with a lake 25 miles in length and three in breadth. The Duke of Lawenburg ſeized and fortified it in 1689, and the king of Denmark took it in 1693 ; but it was diſmantled, and reſtored in 1 700 to the Duke, who re-fortified it. This town has been frequently pillaged, particularly in 1552, by Francis duke of Saxe Lawenburg, becaufe the canons retufed to elect his ſon Magnus their biſhop. It lies nine miles ſouth of Lubec. This place is noted fi>r its excellent beer. E. Long. 10. 58. N. Lat. J3∙ 47∙
